intro: Biscutella radicata, commonly known as the spring sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically features dense clusters of white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are basal, linear, and often covered in a fine layer of white wax. Biscutella radicata is adapted to grow in dry, sandy or rocky soils and is often found in alpine or arctic environments.
